Description: Body and foot sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery plate with slight ring foot; glaze fired red; interior, glazed zone around tondo in which there is a goat (head, neck, chest, and part of one foreleg remaining) to left; exterior reserved save black band on outer edge of foot; ancient repair hole.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.497)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (36, pl. 18, 27)
